summary: The document is a confidential report from the US Army, dated November 28, 1966, concerning a potential defector to the USSR, Vladimir Slovoda. It includes a local agency check conducted by Captain George Bombel, who verified the presence of Private Virgilio Capino for duty during a specified period, despite initial concerns of absence. The document is part of the DOD-affiliated personnel and incident investigations records series and was released with deletions.
key_findings: The document pertains to a potential US Army defector to the USSR, highlighting Cold War tensions.
Captain George Bombel conducted a local agency check to verify the presence of Private Virgilio Capino, who was suspected of being absent but was found present for duty.
The document was classified as CONFIDENTIAL and has been released with deletions, indicating sensitive information was involved.
